instructions.name: admin_withdraw
docs: Admin withdraw funds from Admin Pool

instructions.name: claim_rewards
docs: Lender claim accumulated rewards

instructions.name: close_program_and_refund
docs: Admin close program and refund recovered lamports to pool

instructions.name: close_treasury_pool
docs: Close Treasury Pool account (Admin only)
This closes the treasury pool account and transfers all lamports to admin.
Does NOT require deserializing the account, so it works with old struct layouts.
After closing, call reinitialize_treasury_pool() to create a new account with the updated layout.

accounts.name: treasury_pool
docs: We use UncheckedAccount to avoid deserialization (works with old layouts)
PDA seeds are verified by Anchor constraint, so it's safe to use UncheckedAccount

accounts.name: admin
docs: Admin who will receive the lamports

instructions.name: confirm_deployment_failure
docs: Admin confirm deployment failure

accounts.name: treasury_pda
docs: Note: Recovered funds go back to TreasuryPool, not PlatformPool
PlatformPool only receives 0.1% developer fees

instructions.name: confirm_deployment_success
docs: Admin confirm deployment success

accounts.name: treasury_pda
docs: Note: Recovered funds go back to TreasuryPool, not PlatformPool
PlatformPool only receives 0.1% developer fees

instructions.name: create_deploy_request
docs: Admin create deploy request after payment verification
Only backend admin can call this after verifying developer payment
Payment has already been transferred to Reward Pool

accounts.name: deploy_request
docs: We use UncheckedAccount to handle old layouts, then manually deserialize/resize

instructions.name: credit_fee_to_pool
docs: Credit fees to pools and update reward_per_share
Admin/backend only - called when devs pay fees

instructions.name: deploy_program
docs: [DEPRECATED] Deploy program with both developer and admin signatures
Use request_deployment_funds + confirm_deployment_success instead

instructions.name: emergency_pause
docs: Emergency pause/unpause

instructions.name: fund_temporary_wallet
docs: Admin fund temporary wallet for deployment
Only backend admin can call this to transfer deployment funds
use_admin_pool: true = use Admin Pool, false = use Reward Pool (preferred)

instructions.name: initialize
docs: Initialize the D2D program and treasury pool

instructions.name: pay_subscription
docs: Developer pay monthly subscription

instructions.name: reinitialize_treasury_pool
docs: Reinitialize Treasury Pool (Admin only)
This reinitializes an existing treasury pool account with new struct layout.
Works even if the account has old layout or is rent-exempt.
Use this after closing the old account to migrate to new layout.

accounts.name: treasury_pool
docs: We use UncheckedAccount to avoid deserialization, then manually resize and initialize

instructions.name: request_deployment_funds
docs: Request deployment funds from treasury pool
Backend will use these funds to deploy via pure Web3.js

instructions.name: stake_sol
docs: Lender stake SOL into treasury pool
Kept for backward compatibility (use create_deposit for new code)

instructions.name: suspend_expired_programs
docs: Admin suspend expired programs

instructions.name: sync_liquid_balance
docs: Admin sync liquid_balance with actual account balance
This fixes liquid_balance when it's out of sync with account balance

instructions.name: unstake_sol
docs: Lender unstake SOL from treasury pool
Kept for backward compatibility (use request_withdraw for new code)

instructions.name: update_apy
docs: Admin update APY

errors.name: InvalidSessionStatus
errors.msg: Invalid session status for this operation

errors.name: NegativeTimeElapsed
errors.msg: Negative time elapsed - clock error detected

errors.name: LockPeriodTooLong
errors.msg: Lock period exceeds maximum allowed (10 years)

errors.name: InsufficientPrincipalFunds
errors.msg: Insufficient principal funds in treasury pool

errors.name: DivisionByZero
errors.msg: Division by zero - total deposits is zero

types.name: BackerDeposit
docs: Backer's deposit position in the pool
Reward-per-share model:
- deposited_amount: Amount of SOL deposited (net after fees)
- reward_debt: Tracks accumulated rewards at deposit time (deposited_amount * reward_per_share)
- claimed_total: Total rewards claimed so far

types.name: TreasuryPool
docs: Fee-Based Treasury System with Reward-Per-Share Model
Efficient reward distribution using accumulator pattern:
- reward_per_share: Accumulator that increases when fees are credited
- Each backer tracks reward_debt = deposited_amount * reward_per_share at deposit time
- Claimable = (deposited_amount * reward_per_share - reward_debt) / PRECISION
